bibl.title: Letter, 1808 Jan. 11 Charles Chauncey to John Inskeep 1808 Jan. 11
bibl.note: Insurance Company of North America Records, 1792 December 1 - 1843 February 18

projectDesc.p: Machine-readable transcription created for the University of Tennessee Libraries Special Collections.

editorialDecl.p: Errors in transcription of the printed text not controlled.
Editorial tags limited to gap and unclear.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

revisionDesc.change: Approximate date of original transcription and transcriber.
Migrating from P4 to validated TEI P5.

div.p: President of the North America Insurance Company,

Mr. Edward Dunant & Mr. Johsua Gilpin have placed in my hands two policies of Insurance, effected at your offfice, upon the Brig Garland Oc, on their several accounts & have desired one to bring suit thereon.

Mr. Dunant assured me, that every facility will be given by the office, to bring the causes to a speedy a decision as may be; and I therefore reguest that you will refer me to your attorney, that amicable actions may be entered.

I am also requested by Miss Gently's Banker to call on your office, in the case of the Little Robert, upong which they claim to recover loss, arguably to a statement heretofore handed to the office & I will thank you, sir, to make the like reference to your attorney in this case.

Your letter note of 11th was fild & The Co being were ready to to meet countraded cases in the most amicable way. I have, agreeable to your request instructed Mr. Holkingan to Mem to Re two cases mentioned in your note can en faiathfully J. I. Presdt. Jany 14. 1808
